title: Private Equity
description: 1 Private equity funds engage in portfolio company transactions - mergers and acquisitions, carve-outs, bolt-ons and divestitures - that present unique opportunities for growth in the finite time frame of ownership. A&M private equity-focused professionals are experienced in the "pace of play" in private equity and prioritize the key areas of improvement that will positively impact EBITDA at the portfolio company level.

industries.title: Insurance
industries.description: We work closely with both organizations and regulators within the insurance industry, aiming to enhance performance, achieve financial and operational objectives, and effectively navigate compliance challenges. In the rapidly evolving landscape of the insurance sector, change is accelerating, presenting both opportunities and complexities. We stand prepared to assist you in adeptly managing this transformational journey.

industries.title: Wealth & Asset Management
industries.description: In the ever-evolving landscape of Wealth & Asset Management, businesses must adapt to stay competitive and thrive. At A&M, we recognize the shifting dynamics driven by new regulations, demographic changes, and disruptive technologies reshaping the industry's trajectory.

industries.title: Payments and Financial Markets Infrastructure
industries.description: A&M’s Payments Services helps companies improve margin by turning inefficient integrations into value-added strategies — the original goal of adopting the technology in the first place — and creating successful ground-floor planning and implementations for companies growing, expanding into other markets or wading into unfamiliar financial technology areas, perhaps for the first time.

industries.title: Banking & Capital Markets
industries.description: Our team at A&M brings over four decades of dedicated experience serving the banking and capital markets sector. With a deep understanding of the industry's nuances, we offer a comprehensive suite of tailored services aimed at helping clients create value, seize opportunities, optimize operations, and mitigate risk.

industries.title: Banking & Capital Markets 2
industries.description: Our team at A&M brings over four decades of dedicated experience serving the banking and capital markets sector. With a deep understanding of the industry's nuances, we offer a comprehensive suite of tailored services aimed at helping clients create value, seize opportunities, optimize operations, and mitigate risk.

people.name: Raphael Kiess
people.intro_text: Raphael Kiess is a Managing Director with Alvarez & Marsal’s Disputes and Investigations practice in Munich and Frankfurt am Main. He brings more than 12 years of experience in forensic investigations and forensic technology projects with a focus on digital investigations and compliance projects.
people.quick_facts: 12+ years of experience in forensic investigations and forensic technology projects ;Specializes in digital investigations and compliance ;Industry experience in financial services, asset management, food and beverages, industrial engineering, energy, telecommunication and healthcare
people.body:
Mr. Kiess has managed multinational forensic investigations of corruption, fraud, cartels, anti-dumping, money-laundering, misconduct and intellectual property theft. He has coordinated a number of e-discovery engagements, advising clients on data collection, data processing, document review and document production. Mr. Kiess has worked with clients in a range of industries, including financial services, asset management, food and beverages, industrial engineering, energy, telecommunication and healthcare. He has worked with international teams in Europe and the U.S.

Mr. Kiess’ notable engagements at A&M include managing an investigation into fraud and corruption allegations in Bosnia-Herzegovina and Croatia of senior sales staff for a public health care company accused of having bribed government officials. This work included analysis of financial data, computer forensics, document review and interviews. He worked on a special investigation at a financial institute to identify bribery, embezzlement and the billing of forged invoices, for which he did a special credit check to search for any violations of regulatory requirements.

Mr. Kiess investigated allegations of faked revenues reported by a German industrial company during the due diligence process, finding that the target failed to file for bankruptcy or report its financial status to the acquiring company. He was nominated to provide an expert witness statement in US arbitration proceedings. Mr. Kiess led an international investigation for one of Europe’s largest banks of trader fraud within carbon emission trading; he investigated whether a multinational bank submitted a suspicious activity report, reviewing the bank’s KYP and NCA procedures and providing remediation support. He did a data-based forensic investigation of the Spanish subsidiary of a German public company, analyzing its accounting systems to identify corruptive payments to public officials and its electronic data for signs of bribery or bid rigging. 

Mr. Kiess earned a master’s degree in sociology (Diplom-Soziologe) from LMU Munich. A German citizen, he is fluent in German and English and has advanced skills in Spanish.

insights.title: The Changing Landscape Of Antitrust Scrutiny In A Post-Pandemic World
Corporate Fraud & Corruption
Managing the Growing Complexity of Sanctions Screening in an Era of Rising Global Tensions

people.name: Michael Kahle
people.intro_text: Michael Kahle is a Senior Director with Alvarez & Marsal Corporate Transformation Services in Düsseldorf. He specializes in the retail and consumer goods industry.
people.quick_facts: 20+ years of experience;Expertise in the retail and consumer goods industry;Specializes in senior management and advisory roles in large-scale transformations and turnarounds
people.body:
With more than 20 years of experience, Mr. Kahle has held senior management and senior advisory roles in large-scale transformations and time-critical turnarounds. His primary focus areas are performance improvement programs and commercial transformations, including category management, pricing, sales and marketing effectiveness, omnichannel integration and operating model design and implementation. He has worked in the U.S., Asia and Europe, including serving in line management roles in Europe.

Mr. Kahle has worked across a range of retail and consumer sectors, including grocery, beauty, luxury pharmacy/drugstore, fashion/footwear, jewellery and consumer electronics across all sales channels (from department stores to digital marketplaces). His select exemplary engagements include an interim General Manager role for a European e-commerce group, a turnaround programme for a European e-commerce/marketplace platform optimization; a performance improvement programme for a European pharmacy retail group optimization; and a marketing transformation and retail media business build for a leading European beauty omnichannel retailer.

Prior to joining A&M, Mr. Kahle spent six years with Accenture Strategy, where he most recently served as Managing Director and co-led the retail industry sector for clients in Austria, Switzerland and Germany. He was also responsible for retail M&A activities on buy- and sell-side. Before that, he was part of Kurt Salmon, a global retail strategy consultancy acquired by Accenture, focusing on supporting clients along the retail value chain. 

Previously, Mr. Kahle spent 10 years as an operator in senior management roles with leading omnichannel retailers in Germany and internationally. He also founded an e-commerce start-up company, which exited via a successful going-concern sale to a strategic investor.

Mr. Kahle earned a master’s degree (DiplomKaufmann) from the University of Cologne. He has completed multiple executive education programmes and was a lecturer at Reutlingen University for international retail management. A German national, he is fluent in German and English.
